org.jmc
Class Chunk

java.lang.Object
  org.jmc.Chunk

public class Chunk
extends java.lang.Object

Class describing a chunk. A chunk is a 16x16 group of blocks of varying heights (in Anvil) or 128 (in Region).

Author:
danijel

Field Detail

root

private TAG_Compound root
Root of the loaded chunk structure.

colors

private Colors colors
Color scheme used for the given chunk.

pos_x

private int pos_x
Position of chunk.

pos_z

private int pos_z
Position of chunk.

transparent_blocks

private java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> transparent_blocks
Collection of IDs of transparent blocks. These blocks allow us to see what's behind them. Non-transparent blocks make the sides of neighboring blocks not render.

mesh_types

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,OBJFile.MeshType> mesh_types
A map of mesh types for given block IDs.

is_anvil

private boolean is_anvil
Is the chunk type new Anvil or not. Used to determine how to properly analyze the data.

block_image

private java.awt.image.BufferedImage block_image
64x64 color image of topmost blocks in chunk.

height_image

private java.awt.image.BufferedImage height_image
64x64 grey-scale image of height of topmost blocks.

Constructor Detail

Chunk

public Chunk(java.io.InputStream is,
             boolean is_anvil)
      throws java.lang.Exception
Main constructor of chunks.

Parameters:
is - input stream located at the place in the file where the chunk begins
is_anvil - is the file new Anvil or old Region format
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - throws errors while parsing the chunk

                      java.awt.Rectangle bounds,
                      int ymin)
Creates and retrieves an OBJ file object.

Parameters:
material - MTL file object used in this OBJ file generation
bounds - X and Z limits in player coordinates
ymin - height level above which the export is performed
Returns:
OBJ file object

isDrawable

                           int neighbour_id)
Private method used for checking if the given block ID is drawable from the point of view of of a neighboring block.

Parameters:
block_id - block id of block being checked
neighbour_id - block id of its neighbor

is it drawable
